data.title: Rep. Henry Cuellar denies wrongdoing after indictment
data.meta_description: Rep. Cuellar allegedly had improper ties to an Azerbaijan company.
data.text:
WASHINGTON (Gray DC) - Texas Congressman Henry Cuellar (R) is denies all wrongdoing after he and his wife were indicted on conspiracy and bribery charges on Friday.

The Justice Department alleges the couple accepted nearly $600,000 from a Mexican bank and Azerbaijan energy company between 2014-2021.

In return, the Texas Democrat allegedly agreed to deliver a pro-Azerbaijan speech on the house floor and influence legislation in favor of the central-Asian country, once part of the Soviet Bloc.

Until proven innocent, Cuellar will take leave as ranking member of the Homeland Security Appropriations Subcommittee.

In 2022, the FBI raided the congressmanâ€™s Laredo home in connection to this investigation.
